metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5669 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The do_shmat function in ipc/shm.c in the Linux kernel through 4.9.12 does not restrict the address calculated by a certain rounding operation, which allows local users to map page zero, and consequently bypass a protection mechanism that exists for the mmap system call, by making crafted shmget and shmat system calls in a privileged context. Gareth Evans discovered that the shm IPC subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict mapping page zero. A local privileged attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-142-generic - 3.13.0-142.191
